intro: Galium siccatum, commonly known as Sicilian bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. Galium siccatum is often found in dry, open habitats such as roadsides and grassy areas.
